CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE an article entitled “ Experts have doubts about the impartiality of the child ombudsman . Children are weapons in bitter disputes . ” was published in a magazine PERSON article , written by a free - lance journalist PERSON , concerned the applicant and her work .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted criminal proceedings against ORG , the editor - in - chief of the magazine , PERSON , and the publishing company ORG before the then ORG ( raastuvanoikeus , rådstuvurätt ) of GPE , for public defamation , alleging that the article insulted and defamed her professional experience . On DATE the court dismissed the action . It referred to the amendments to LAW ( painovapauslaki , tryckfrihetslag ) , according to which the proceedings should have been initiated before ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) of GPE . Apparently the applicant ’s counsel failed to lodge new charges in time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted criminal - based civil proceedings against ORG , ORG and the publishing company before ORG of Espoo , requesting compensation for non - pecuniary damage of MONEY ( ORG , amounting to MONEY ( ORG ) ) for mental distress and suffering due to the allegedly incriminating and insulting nature of the article .
CARDINAL . The defendants lodged a counterclaim , which was served on the applicant on DATE . She lodged an additional claim on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The defendants served their written submissions on DATE . On DATE the applicant submitted further written submissions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a preparatory hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the principal trial , which terminated on DATE after a hearing , which DATE .
CARDINAL . By its judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims and ordered her to reimburse the GPE legal costs . She appealed to ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel requested an extension of the time - limit for the appeal . This was extended to CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicant lodged her appeal documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to suspend the enforcement of ORG judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed her request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the parties to submit written observations . These were received on DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted further written evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the defendants to submit their observations on the further evidence and the applicant to submit her comments on the new witnesses proposed by the defendants . It informed the parties that there would be an oral hearing and proposed dates in DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , the dates fixed had to be vacated due to the unavailability of the parties . The hearing took place instead on CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE . The parties were told that the judgment would be delivered on DATE . This however was postponed due to the illness of CARDINAL of the judges .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG revoked the judgment of ORG , finding a part of the article to be defamatory . It ordered the defendants to pay the applicant CARDINAL FIM ( ORG CARDINAL ) plus interest for non - pecuniary damage caused by the defamation . It further ordered that both parties should bear their own legal costs incurred before the domestic courts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sought leave to appeal from ORG and lodged further submissions on DATE . On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal .
